Detailed Description

Provide Open Settlement Protocol capability.

Author:
Mark Spencer <markster@digium.com>
  • See also: chan_sip.c

char* key (  void   ) 
 

Returns the ASTERISK_GPL_KEY.

This returns the ASTERISK_GPL_KEY, signifiying that you agree to the terms of the GPL stated in the ASTERISK_GPL_KEY. Your module will not load if it does not return the EXACT message:

 char *key(void) {
         return ASTERISK_GPL_KEY;
 }

Returns:
ASTERISK_GPL_KEY

00414     int retVal = OSPC_ERR_NO_ERROR;
00415 
00416     temp = buffer;
00417 
00418     bioIn = BIO_new_file((const char*)FileName,"r");
00419     if (bioIn == NULL)
00420     {
00421       ast_log(LOG_WARNING,"Failed to find the File - %s \n",FileName);
00422       return -1;
00423     }
00424     else
00425     {
00426         pKey = PEM_read_bio_RSAPrivateKey(bioIn,NULL,NULL,NULL);
00427         if (pKey == NULL)
00428         {
00429          ast_log(LOG_WARNING,"Failed to parse the Private Key from the File - %s \n",FileName);
00430          return -1;
00431         }
00432         else
00433         {
00434             length = i2d_RSAPrivateKey(pKey,&temp);
00435             if (length == 0)
00436             {
00437             ast_log(LOG_WARNING,"Failed to parse the Private Key from the File - %s, Length=0 \n",FileName);
00438             return -1;
00439             }
00440             else
00441             {
00442                 *len = length;
00443             }
00444         }
00445     }
00446     if (bioIn != NULL)
00447     {
00448         BIO_free(bioIn);
00449     }
00450 
00451     if (pKey != NULL)
00452     {
00453        RSA_free(pKey);
00454     }
00455     return retVal;
00456 }

int usecount (  void   ) 
 

Provides a usecount.

This function will be called by various parts of asterisk. Basically, all it has to do is to return a usecount when called. You will need to maintain your usecount within the module somewhere. The usecount should be how many channels provided by this module are in use.

Returns:
The module's usecount.

00865    /* We should never be unloaded */
00866    return 1;
